===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|の|ひ|k2=び|yomi=k}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=のび|野|tr1=no|t1=field|火|tr2=hi|t2=fire}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> {{rendaku2|sort=のび|hi|bi}}

An ancient variant seen in eastern Japan uses the dialectal reading ''nu'' for {{lang|ja|野}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|のび|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|のび}}

{{ja-altread|hira=ぬび}} {{qualifier|obsolete}}

# a [[controlled burn]] set in early spring to [[clear]] away [[brush]] from mountain fields
# a [[wildfire]]

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{ja-l|燹}} {{qualifier|rare}}

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|controlled agricultural burn}} {{ja-r|野焼き|のやき}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=ほそけ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ほそけ|火|tr1=ho|t1=fire|退く|tr2=soku|t2=to push away, to make distant}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The [[kun'yomi]] for {{ja-l|火}} is usually ''hi'', but it can appear as ''ho'' or ''fu'', particularly in older compounds.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The ''soku'' changes to ''soke'' due to [[conjugation]] of the verb. Grammatically, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of ''soki'' was used for intransitive senses, and the stem form of ''soke'' was used for the transitive senses.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

The kanji {{lang|ja|野火}} are an example of [[熟字訓#Japanese|jukujikun]].

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|ほそけ}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ほそけ}} {{lb|ja|rare|sort=ほそけ}}

# a [[backburn]]: a [[controlled]] fire deliberately set in the path of a [[wildfire]] to create a [[firebreak]] by removing [[combustible]] material

=====Alternative forms=====
* {{ja-l|火退}} {{qualifier|rare}}
* {{ja-l|逆焼}} {{qualifier|rare}}
* {{ja-l|燹}} {{qualifier|rare}}

=====Usage notes=====
The more common word for this is {{ja-l|向火}}, {{ja-r|向かい火|むかいび}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-l|向火}}, {{ja-r|向かい火|むかいび}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|や|か|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=やか}} {{m|zh|野火|tr=yæ<sup>X</sup> xwa<sup>X</sup>|lit=open country + fire}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|やか|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やか|hhira=やくわ}}

# a [[controlled]] [[burn]] set to [[clear]] away [[brush]] from fields
# a [[fire]] set in a field
# a [[wildfire]]
# a [[will o' the wisp]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|controlled agricultural burn; wildfire}} {{ja-r|燎原|りょうげん}}
* {{sense|will o' the wisp}} {{ja-r|鬼火|おにび}}, {{ja-r|狐火|きつねび}}, {{ja-r|狐日|きつねび}}, {{ja-r|陰火|いんか}}, {{ja-r|幽霊火|ゆうれいび}}, {{ja-r|不知火|しらぬい}}
